reviews.review_msg: She is a good professor however her final is ridiculous. There was so much content and the textbook was useless in answering what she expects the class to know. Lots of reading for a 100 level course and tough marking TAs.

She is a wonderful professor who spoke very clearly and consistently throughout lectures. She does move quite fast but lecture notes are uploaded before hand. Very handy if your using a laptop. I personally did not find her boring at all. If you have interests in the subject she is teaching, you should have no problems. Tutorials are free marks!

She is a very nice, funny person, however the lectures are extremely boring. I've only not fought to fall asleep twice and I am NOT the type of person to fall asleep in class. The class is interesting though, and my TA is nice. If you don't mind the boring lectures, its definitely worth it.

Very boring lectures!  all the notes were posted after the lecture.  Tutorials and assignments were the best part of the course.  and my TA was amazing too.  There was a lot of useless material in the lectures and for the final exam, you'll need to know a lot of info.  The material is not too challenging though.

Probably too much information covered in lecture for a first year class. Most info was random facts and stats that were useless. Final exam was easy, but class structure and syllabus needs a major overhaul.

She's a nice person. HOWEVER, I felt really bad for all those first years in the course, only because she claimed that the amount of work that was assigned was an average amount for a first year course.  It's not.  I took a 2nd year philosophy course and that had much less writing and reading overall.
Super nice and easy to understand in lecture. She talk pretty fast and goes through the slides quickly, but will slow down if you ask. She keeps the class interesting and encourages many questions.
good teacher, clear and loud lectures and she is reasonable.

This professor does not teaches this course. The course is EXTREMELY hard and difficult, with SO MUCH to read and so many lectures to listen too. The exams are not built fairly, with 24 minutes to complete 40 multiple choices!! I would not recommend to ANYONE this course! And even if you like the topics, its just not worth the stress you'll get!

hard to rate bc she didn't teach. the vids didn't have subtitles so i rewinded a lot. the assignments were straightforward (got 96 &86). i didn't like the exams (35 secs per question and the written part had ABCDE). discussion groups were annoying but easy. didn't watch the lecture vids till the exams and spent less than 2 hours a week on the class

Please don't take REM100. This was the hardest course I've ever taken and I'm not a first-year student. There is a LOT of writing - 2 essays, which are marked unfairly for a 100-level course, and weekly discussions. Lectures are painfully boring and hard to understand, thus making it difficult to stay engaged in this course. The exams are HARD.

Huge work load with at least 2 discussion posts for every week.
Lectures videos aren't even made by her. It's from the past professor who was in charge of REM100.
Tests are confusing and the time limit makes me more anxious. It's 35 seconds per question which is insane.

I needed to add this professor as was not previously listed for those of you wondering how REM100 is. First of all, she is not teaching. The lectures and course design are solely by Pascal Haegali, you can see his own reviews. Anyways, this course is extremely hard, the exams are on an anxiety inducing time crunch and unforgiving. VERY difficult.
